Aniket Srinivasan Ashok

Undergraduate @ University of Waterloo

Email GitHub LinkedIn Resume

I’m an undergraduate student at the University of Waterloo studying Data Science and Pure Mathematics. My research interests lie in machine learning — particularly generative models and applied ML systems.

Currently, I’m a Software Engineer Intern at Viggle AI working on product and applied AI. Thus summer, I’ll be joining Faire as an ML Platform Engineer Intern.

I also work part-time as an ML Researcher at Bradbury Group on training methodologies for multimodal image editing adapters. We are actively looking for co-authors, so send me an email if you are interested in contributing.


Things I’m Doing

  • Eating and putting my thoughts in Plate.
  • Sometimes hosting research hackathons (you should come!)
  • Reading ML papers; I hope to soon write about some of my favourite ones!


Things I’ve Done

  • I went on exchange to the National University of Singapore (NUS) for Fall 2025.
  • I demoed audio-reactive generative art at the Socratica Symposium 2025.
  • I was the first engineering hire at CaseClock where I built AI-native products for lawyers, from scratch.
  • I researched wind dynamics super-resolution with Jacob Schnell, under Prof. Yuhao Chen, at the University of Waterloo.
  • I wrote algorithms for stable and deterministic module replacement in transformers with the Bradbury Group.
